snippet: In a country that has gone after financiers with far more vigor than others hit by the financial crisis, obtaining convictions has proved devilishly difficult.
abstract: Icelandic authorities say obtaining criminal convictions for bankers responsible for 2008 collapse is extremely difficult, even in country that has gone after financiers with far more vigor than others hit by financial crisis; only handful of bankers have been convicted since special prosecutor was set up to investigate country's financial meltdown.
lead_paragraph: In a country that has gone after financiers with far more vigor than others hit by the financial crisis, obtaining convictions has proved devilishly difficult.

headline.seo: Iceland, Prosecutor of Bankers, Sees Meager Returns
headline.main: Iceland, Fervent Prosecutor of Bankers, Sees Meager Returns
headline.print_headline: Iceland, Fervent Prosecutor of Bankers, Sees Meager Returns
